DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , double-blind , multicenter , fix dose factorial study Q8003 12 mg/8 mg versus individual morphine sulfate oxycodone hydrochloride component management acute moderate severe postoperative pain follow bunionectomy surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Efficacy Safety Q8003 Versus Its Individual Components Bunionectomy Patients
DOC.criteria: Patient male female least 18 year age . Females must nonpregnant , nonlactating , practice acceptable method birth control , surgically sterile postmenopausal ( amenorrhea ≥ 12 month ) . Nonpregnancy confirm pregnancy test conduct Screening Pretreatment . Patient schedule bunionectomy surgery , meet criteria ASA Class I III , willing stay study center least 48 hour initial dose study medication post surgery . To randomize surgery , patient must report moderate severe pain ( score 2 4 point Likert scale least 4 11 point NPRS scale ) . In opinion Investigator , history pulmonary , cardiovascular ( include uncontrolled hypertension ) , neurologic , endocrine , hepatic , gastrointestinal , kidney disease therapy , opinion Investigator , would jeopardize patient 's well participation study mentally emotionally unsuitable participate , unable/unwilling comply study assessment . Used opiates continuously ( include tramadol ) ten day past year . Hypersensitivity poor tolerance ibuprofen short term opioids . Currently receive medication stable dose ( dose > 4 week prior date surgery ) . Was dose another investigational drug within 30 day prior Screening Visit previously receive treatment Q8003 . Current therapy central nervous system depressant medication might increase risk treatment opioids ( used surgical anesthesia ) . Current evidence alcohol abuse ( regularly drink 4 unit alcohol per day ; 1 unit = ½ pint beer , 1 glass wine , 1 ounce spirit ) .
